page.title: 03Weather in Arden
page.content: Arden is in the west of Scotland. The weather is very mixed. There is often a west wind which brings rain. There is some snow almost every winter and there can be a short drought in the summer. In the spring time there is often an east wind which makes everything very dry. There was a very hot summer in 1984. Some houses whose water supply came from a spring were short of water. The winter of 1983 - 1984 was very snowy. Some pupils could not get not get to school and the school had to be closed for two days. In autumn the Loch Lomond road can be flooded. The damp climate makes the area very green and beautiful.
